cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi ESE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting west then turning northwest toward the central-upper Texas coast and Galveston Bay
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central-upper Texas coast between Matagorda Bay and High Island (near/just southwest of Galveston Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Aransas TX to High Island TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas TX to Intracoastal City LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island, including Galveston Bay, and portions of southwestern Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts; a brief period of near-hurricane strength possible) could affect the port beginning late Sunday night and persist through Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible in Galveston Bay and adjacent waterways, including the Houston Ship Channel.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated higher totals, producing flash and urban flooding around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; prolonged high waves in the ship channel; possible minor river flooding delaying barge traffic.
